title: [Self-directed] Machine Learning-Based Instructional Design for Mobile Learning Taxonomy

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary machine learning concepts, mobile learning environment comprehension, and foundational language education design principles
context.additional_context: Conducted in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment, with project-based assessments measuring design competencies. Focuses on understanding mobile learning design taxonomies in language education and applying machine learning models

learning_goals: Learners can classify mobile learning designs according to three criteria: cognitive level, inquiry learning stages, and contextual environment roles
Learners can convert text-based mobile learning design data into features applicable to machine learning models
Learners can compare the performance-interpretability trade-off between EstBERT and logistic regression models to select appropriate classification models
Learners can apply machine learning-based classification models to real-world language education scenarios to derive design analysis results

resources: Machine learning development environment (e.g., Google Colab)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
